top_categories.workout_context: Racing USA Cycling Gravel Nationals isn’t just fitness — it’s pacing, fueling, and executing when conditions deteriorate. This workout practices the race itself.
USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s champagne gravel, blufftop climbs demands rapid power changes — surge over obstacles, settle on smoother sections, repeat for hours.
At 131 miles, USA Cycling Gravel Nationals punishes athletes who haven’t trained their body to produce power when glycogen runs low.
USA Cycling Gravel Nationals rewards athletes who can hold sustained power without blowing up — threshold is the engine that drives everything above Zone 2.
USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs and competitive field demand explosive aerobic capacity — the ability to respond to surges without blowing up.
Over-unders train the lactate clearance you’ll need at USA Cycling Gravel Nationals when surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding hard.
The G-Spot zone (88–92% FTP) is where you’ll spend the hardest sustained miles of USA Cycling Gravel Nationals. Make this intensity feel like home.
Critical power determines how long you can sustain above-threshold efforts at USA Cycling Gravel Nationals — a higher CP means more time in the red before failure.

Short, violent efforts are unavoidable at USA Cycling Gravel Nationals — climbs demanding 2-minute maximal efforts, surges to close gaps, attacks on driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs.
Blended sessions combine endurance with intensity spikes — exactly what USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs delivers on race day.
USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s 7,000ft of climbing demands seated and standing versatility — the ability to change climbing style as gradient and fatigue dictate.
The Norwegian double-threshold method builds the sustained power base for USA Cycling Gravel Nationals — massive training stimulus without the recovery cost of VO2max work.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 60–80g carbs/hour for USA Cycling Gravel Nationals’s 131 miles. Start fueling within the first 30 minutes — early fueling prevents late-race collapse. Bonking at mile 60 is a nutrition failure, not a fitness failure.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at USA Cycling Gravel Nationals requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs to build confidence. Expect: champagne gravel, blufftop climbs, rolling farm roads.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Race Simulation, Gravel Specific, and Durability to prepare you for 131 miles of driftless 'champagne gravel' and punchy blufftop climbs in La Crescent, Minnesota (2025-26); previously Gering, Nebraska (2023-24).
